sn15.10:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn15.10:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn15.10:5.2: One person roaming and transmigrating for an eon would amass a heap of bones the size of this Mount Vepulla, if they were gathered together and not lost.
sn15.10:5.5: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.”
sn15.10:6.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn15.10:6.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn15.10:7.2: for a single eon were gathered up,
sn15.10:7.3: they’d make a pile the size of a mountain:
sn15.10:8.1: And this is declared to be
sn15.10:9.2: a person sees the noble truths—
sn15.10:9.6: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
sn15.10:10.1: After roaming on for seven times at most,
sn15.10:10.4: with the ending of all fetters.”
